Heavy_Horn.description: A crude horn used by hilichurls to warn each other. Given the damage to the horn, it won't be warning anyone any time soon.
Heavy_Horn.name: Heavy Horn

Black_Bronze_Horn.description: A metallic monster horn that can only be obtained from especially strong hilichurls, since blowing on the horn takes real strength.
Black_Bronze_Horn.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Heavy Horn)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Mitachurls
Black_Bronze_Horn.name: Black Bronze Horn

Black_Crystal_Horn.description: A metallic horn with an ominous shine decorated with black crystals of an unknown source. It has hardly been used at all. It is likely a ceremonial item of the hilichurls'.
Black_Crystal_Horn.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Black Bronze Horn)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Mitachurls
Black_Crystal_Horn.name: Black Crystal Horn

Dead_Ley_Line_Branch.description: Fragile branches from deep within the earth. Even after years of age, from beneath it's mottled surface you can see that its power is not yet entirely lost.
Dead_Ley_Line_Branch.name: Dead Ley Line Branch

Dead_Ley_Line_Leaves.description: A twig from deep within the earth. Though it is far from where it once lay, its leaves still pulsate with energy.
Dead_Ley_Line_Leaves.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Dead Ley Line Branch)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Abyss Mages
Dead_Ley_Line_Leaves.name: Dead Ley Line Leaves

Ley_Line_Sprouts.description: It is said that there was a great tree whose roots once spread out to every corner of the world, and this branch is said to be part of it. It is almost if it was never broken off and taken far away, for its vitality is such that it still sprouts new leaves even now.
Ley_Line_Sprouts.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Dead Ley Line Leaves)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Abyss Mages
Ley_Line_Sprouts.name: Ley Line Sprouts

Fragile_Bone_Shard.description: A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap Hatchling. Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.
Fragile_Bone_Shard.name: Fragile Bone Shard

Sturdy_Bone_Shard.description:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishap Hatchlings for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.
Sturdy_Bone_Shard.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Fragile Bone Shard)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Geovishap Hatchlings
Sturdy_Bone_Shard.name: Sturdy Bone Shard

Fossilized_Bone_Shard.description:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishap Hatchlings.
Geovishap Hatchlings all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.
Fossilized_Bone_Shard.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Sturdy Bone Shard)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Geovishap Hatchlings
Fossilized_Bone_Shard.name: Fossilized Bone Shard

Mist_Grass_Pollen.description: Strange spores created by Mist Grass in enclosed spaces. They are the Cicins' favorite food.
Mist_Grass_Pollen.name: Mist Grass Pollen

Mist_Grass.description: Well-preserved Mist Grass. Some would take advantage of the Cicins' love for the Mist Grass to control them.
Mist_Grass.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Mist Grass Pollen)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Electro Cicin Mages
Mist_Grass.name: Mist Grass

Mist_Grass_Wick.description: A rare bundle of Mist Grass that gives off a faint glow. Those who carry it invite both the Cicins and misfortune.
Mist_Grass_Wick.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Mist Grass)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Electro Cicin Mages
Mist_Grass_Wick.name: Mist Grass Wick

Hunter_Sacrificial_Knife.description: A sharp alloy weapon. Though its owner has been lost, it still reflects a disturbingly cold light.
Hunter_Sacrificial_Knife.name: Hunter's Sacrificial Knife

Agent_Sacrificial_Knife.description: An oddly-shaped weapon made with superior Snezhnayan technology that once belonged to a senior agent. Proper training is required for using this strange weapon.
Agent_Sacrificial_Knife.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Hunter's Sacrificial Knife)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Agents
Agent_Sacrificial_Knife.name: Agent's Sacrificial Knife

Inspector_Sacrificial_Knife.description: In the hands of its lord, this fierce weapon has handled many "debts." No-one has eyes in the back of their heads, and this weapon and its related techniques are designed around that weakness.
Inspector_Sacrificial_Knife.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Agent's Sacrificial Knife)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Agents
Inspector_Sacrificial_Knife.name: Inspector's Sacrificial Knife

Chaos_Device.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. A part that once held the structure together. Its aesthetically-pleasing engineering is quite exquisite.
Chaos_Device.obtained:
- Dropped by Ruin Guards
- Dropped by Ruin Hunters
Chaos_Device.name: Chaos Device

Chaos_Circuit.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. Was once a logic circuit responsible for movement functions. Sadly, no-one is able to make sense of how it worked.
Chaos_Circuit.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Device)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Ruin Guards
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Ruin Hunters
Chaos_Circuit.name: Chaos Circuit

Chaos_Core.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. The core that once drove a mechanical beast. Should you come to understand its workings and reproduce it, you could perhaps change the world.
Chaos_Core.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Circuit)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Ruin Guards
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Ruin Hunters
Chaos_Core.name: Chaos Core

Dismal_Prism.description: This was once a prism that could polarize light, but has grown dull through the passing of years.
Dismal_Prism.name: Dismal Prism

Crystal_Prism.description: A prism that can bend light. Illusory images can be made using such prisms, giving such devices — in a manner of speaking — the power to sway human hearts.
Crystal_Prism.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Dismal Prism)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Mirror Maidens
Crystal_Prism.name: Crystal Prism

Polarizing_Prism.description: A prism that can bend light. In the darkness, these prisms can spread thin light into a wider area. Perhaps this is due to this quirk that these prisms can grant a measure of peace to those whose hearts are oft shrouded in darkness.
Polarizing_Prism.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Crystal Prism)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Mirror Maidens
Polarizing_Prism.name: Polarizing Prism

Chaos_Gear.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin machine.
This is the energy source of that biomimetic mechanism.
Chaos_Gear.name: Chaos Gear

Chaos_Axis.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin machine.
Even the great techniques and unknown power of this device must come to nothing should the machine that contained them ever fail to maintain structural integrity.
Chaos_Axis.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Gear)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Ruin Sentinels
Chaos_Axis.name: Chaos Axis

Chaos_Oculus.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin machine.
The "Ruin" part of the name comes from the areas where they are most active. However, Ruin machines actually have little in common with the detritus in which they are often found.
In the ancient past, these ruins were once part of a civilization mighty enough to almost touch the dome of the firmament, while "ruin" still waits in the deep places of the earth, awaiting the order to arise and tread all kingdoms underfoot.
Chaos_Oculus.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Axis)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Ruin Sentinels
Chaos_Oculus.name: Chaos Oculus

Concealed_Claw.description:
Residual body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
By ordinary logic, these objects, so alien to this world, should not have remained behind after these abnormal creatures were excised from the land.
Concealed_Claw.name: Concealed Claw

Concealed_Unguis.description:
Body tissue left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
Though they are quite wondrous indeed, these hunting hounds of "Alfisol" are nothing of note before Durin of "Humus."
Concealed_Unguis.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Concealed Claw)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Rifthounds
Concealed_Unguis.name: Concealed Unguis

Concealed_Talon.description:
A sharp nail left behind by one of the Riftwolves.
All the marvels in the world must pale before "Cretaceus", the greatest work of them all.
Concealed_Talon.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Concealed Unguis)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Rifthounds
Concealed_Talon.name: Concealed Talon

Gloomy_Statuette.description:
An idol made in the likeness of some unknown person.
Even though this carving has seen many years pass, it still has not been damaged in any way. It seems that its previous owner must have cherished it like some holy icon.
Gloomy_Statuette.obtained: - Dropped by Abyss Heralds, Abyss Lectors and Shadowy Husks
Gloomy_Statuette.name: Gloomy Statuette

Dark_Statuette.description:
An idol made in the likeness of some unknown, one-eyed person.
You can feel a strange warmth emanating from within as you hold onto it, like the shoulder of a dear friend. Perhaps this icon can indeed give people who understand its significance the courage to carry on.
Dark_Statuette.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Gloomy Statuette)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Abyss Heralds, Abyss Lectors and Shadowy Husks
Dark_Statuette.name: Dark Statuette

Deathly_Statuette.description:
A one-eyed carving that emanates an ominous energy, with no indication of what it's made of.
As you gaze upon this idol, you can almost hear a strange, comforting whisper...
"See, my child. All that lies under the throne of heaven shall be destroyed by upheaval. The eternal peace of the pitch-dark void shall embrace us all."
Deathly_Statuette.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Dark Statuette)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Abyss Heralds, Abyss Lectors and Shadowy Husks
Deathly_Statuette.name: Deathly Statuette

Chaos_Storage.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin Drake.
Ruin Drakes can absorb Elemental Energy from the outside and store it in this component inside their "neck".
Chaos_Storage.name: Chaos Storage

Chaos_Module.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin Drake.
The dragons were once the most primitive and ancient bodily form of the supreme elements until they were defeated, conquered, or assimilated.
Chaos_Module.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Storage)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Ruin Drakes
Chaos_Module.name: Chaos Module

Chaos_Bolt.description:
Comes from a now-inactive ancient Ruin Drake.
Among the lost ancient kingdoms, there was a group of people who were obsessed with the idea of mimesis. Be it the Hypostases' pure ordered elements or the ancient primitive power of the dragons, these people believed that they might all be replicated and modified to the point where they had surpassed their natural counterparts.
By this means, a superior and unsullied bodily form could replace the continuously decaying and shattering order.
Chaos_Bolt.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Chaos Module)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Ruin Drakes
Chaos_Bolt.name: Chaos Bolt

Inactivated_Fungal_Nucleus.description:
Body tissue left behind by a Fungus that has been exposed to intense elemental stimulation.
Its soothing texture makes it shockingly good for stress relief. However, frequent usage can also easily lead to the Fungi multiplying, and thus the material is not suitable for any commercial use.
Inactivated_Fungal_Nucleus.obtained:
- Dropped by Fungi (activated)
- Dropped by Fungi (scorched)
Inactivated_Fungal_Nucleus.name: Inactivated Fungal Nucleus

Dormant_Fungal_Nucleus.description:
Body tissue left behind by a Fungus that has been exposed to intense elemental stimulation.
There was once a protracted debate among Amurta researchers on whether the Fungi should be categorized as plants or animals. In the end, they reached an agreement and closed the case for good — the Fungi shall be its own category, neither plant nor animal.
Dormant_Fungal_Nucleus.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Inactivated Fungal Nucleus)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Fungi (activated)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Fungi (scorched)
Dormant_Fungal_Nucleus.name: Dormant Fungal Nucleus

Robust_Fungal_Nucleus.description:
Body tissue left behind by a Fungus that has been exposed to intense elemental stimulation.
It is generally believed that the Fungi evolved into more mobile forms to better disperse their spores.
A poet once depicted a shared dream of the Fungi in which their spores covered every inch of the mountains and oceans. The world had never been more tranquil. Then the Fungi turned into fish, birds, beasts, men, and gods, relying on rainfall, land, and their own kind who had returned to the earth.
Robust_Fungal_Nucleus.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Dormant Fungal Nucleus)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Fungi (activated)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Fungi (scorched)
Robust_Fungal_Nucleus.name: Robust Fungal Nucleus

Damaged_Prism.description:
A damaged component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.
These uniquely-shaped machines are the eternal sentinels of the desert ruins, and they possess the power to pierce the mountains and reshape rocks. The same principles that power many mysterious devices above and beneath the earth also power these machines.
Damaged_Prism.name: Damaged Prism

Turbid_Prism.description:
An old component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.
>It is said that these machines are different from those ruin machines that come from deep within the desert, for they were not made as heralds of destruction or conquest.
Turbid_Prism.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Damaged Prism)
- Dropped by Lv.40+ Primal Construct: Reshaper
Turbid_Prism.name: Turbid Prism

Radiant_Prism.description:
An exquisite component obtained from defeating a Primal Construct.
The lord of the barren desert once had a dream, and once made a great many promises.
The legends of the desert say that these machines were originally vehicles for these unknown promises, which now live on only within their mechanical memory banks.
Radiant_Prism.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Turbid Prism)
- Dropped by Lv.60+ Primal Construct: Reshaper
Radiant_Prism.name: Radiant Prism

Desiccated_Shell.description:
The ruined shell of a Consecrated Beast.
A tangible effigy to the grand calamity that devoured the lands of yore, usually only discovered in places few dare tread.
Desiccated_Shell.name: Desiccated Shell

Sturdy_Shell.description:
A sturdy shell of a Consecrated Beast.
The remains of a ruinous beast that once gnawed at the flesh of great, fallen beings. Even should the beasts sup a sliver of power from the gods of yesteryear, they too will greet the same and as said gods.
Sturdy_Shell.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Desiccated Shell)
- Dropped by Consecrated Beasts
Sturdy_Shell.name: Sturdy Shell

Marked_Shell.description: The marked shell of a Consecrated Beast inscribed with ancient script.On the pallid contours of the shell, the regrets of a time long past have been inlaid. One day, the bones of the beast will scatter like dust in the wind, and then, finally, may the exalted deceased greet their final rest…
Marked_Shell.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Sturdy Shell)
- Dropped by Consecrated Beasts
Marked_Shell.name: Marked Shell

A_Flower_Yet_to_Bloom.description:
A wild flower that a Hilichurl Rogue treasured. It was plucked before it could bloom.
The hilichurl takes nothing with it in its sojourn across the wilderness save this flower.
A_Flower_Yet_to_Bloom.name: A Flower Yet to Bloom

Treasured_Flower.description:
A wild flower that a Hilichurl Rogue treasured, bereft of any special qualities.
Flowers can be used as gifts or offerings to express one's feelings in many cultures.
Treasured_Flower.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x A Flower Yet to Bloom)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Hilichurl Rogues
Treasured_Flower.name: Treasured Flower

Wanderers_Blooming_Flower.description:
A blooming wild flower that a Hilichurl Rogue treasured, bereft of any special qualities.
The eternal outlander asks not for reward, but only to see their deeds come to fruition...
Wanderers_Blooming_Flower.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Treasured Flower)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Hilichurl Rogues
Wanderers_Blooming_Flower.name: Wanderer's Blooming Flower

Drop_of_Tainted_Water.description:
A small drop of water obtained from a defeated Tainted Hydro Phantasm.
The life force in it has yet to ebb away.
Drop_of_Tainted_Water.obtained:
- Dropped by Tainted Hydro Phantasms
- Stardust Exchange
Drop_of_Tainted_Water.name: Drop of Tainted Water

Scoop_of_Tainted_Water.description:
Water obtained from a defeated Tainted Hydro Phantasm.
The life force in it has yet to ebb away.
Today, with the Oceanids extirpated from Fontaine, strange elemental life forms that are far from elegant have appeared in the waters.
Scoop_of_Tainted_Water.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Drop of Tainted Water)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Tainted Hydro Phantasms
- Stardust Exchange
Scoop_of_Tainted_Water.name: Scoop of Tainted Water

Newborn_Tainted_Hydro_Phantasm.description:
A new lifeform that arose from the dispersed Tainted Hydro Phantasm Tainted Hydro Phantasm.
It is trapped inside a bottle.
The life contained within the waters is formless, and formless life is born of water and gains water's shape.
Newborn_Tainted_Hydro_Phantasm.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Scoop of Tainted Water)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Tainted Hydro Phantasms
Newborn_Tainted_Hydro_Phantasm.name: Newborn Tainted Hydro Phantasm

Rift_Core.description:
A shard left by Breacher Primus.
It bears no resemblance to any other known form of life in the world.
Rift_Core.obtained:
- Dropped by Breacher Primuses
- Stardust Exchange
Rift_Core.name: Rift Core

Foreign_Synapse.description:
A shard left by Breacher Primus.
This strange life form originates in Elynas and inhabits the area.
Foreign_Synapse.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Rift Core)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Breacher Primuses
- Stardust Exchange
Foreign_Synapse.name: Foreign Synapse

Alien_Life_Core.description:
Breacher Primus's Core.
Ther is no way to exterminate this life form. One reduced to nothing but its core will resurrect the next day or in decades. Luckily, it is neither aggressive nor intelligent, so Fontainians can just keep their distance.
Alien_Life_Core.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Foreign Synapse)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Breacher Primuses
Alien_Life_Core.name: Alien Life Core

Old_Operatives_Pocket_Watch.description:
A standard-issue pocket watch given to Fatui Operatives.
The erosion and oxidation on the casing serve as a loyal record of its owners' days spent as an instrument, enforcing the Fatui's will.
Old_Operatives_Pocket_Watch.obtained:
- Dropped by Wind Operatives and Frost Operatives
- Stardust Exchange
Old_Operatives_Pocket_Watch.name: Old Operative's Pocket Watch

Operatives_Standard_Pocket_Watch.description:
A standard-issue pocket watch given to Fatui Operatives.
The head of the watch is not well-designed, as the outer casing has way too many sharp angles, which can cause excessive wear and tear on clothes. As such, there will always be those who will stuff this watch into a more practical, less distinctive casing for use.
Operatives_Standard_Pocket_Watch.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Old Operative's Pocket Watch)
- Dropped by Lv. 40+ Wind Operatives and Frost Operatives
- Stardust Exchange
Operatives_Standard_Pocket_Watch.name: Operative's Standard Pocket Watch

Operatives_Constancy.description:
An accessory with a Delusion mounted on it. This is source of the Fatui Operative's power.
That said, taking it off would not detract from the fact that said Operative has physical abilities far beyond that of ordinary humans, forged through long years of training and combat experience. As for them, they are well-aware that they have sacrificed their past, present, and future upon the altar of the Fatui's ideal paradise, such that the damage they cause themselves on account of using a Delusion's power matters not at all.
Operatives_Constancy.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Operative's Standard Pocket Watch)
- Dropped by Lv. 60+ Wind Operatives and Frost Operatives
Operatives_Constancy.name: Operative's Constancy

Feathery_Fin.description:
A fin fragment taken from a defeated Xuanwen Beast's back.
Even though Xuanwen Beasts can't fly over long distances, these feather-like fins enable them to swiftly pursue their prey.
Feathery_Fin.obtained:
- Dropped by Xuanwen Beasts
- Stardust Exchange
Feathery_Fin.name: Feathery Fin

Lunar_Fin.description:
A fin taken from a defeated Xuanwen Beast's back.
The soft, moonlight-esque glow on the fin gives off a sense of serenity.
Lunar_Fin.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Feathery Fin)
- Dropped by Xuanwen Beasts
- Stardust Exchange
Lunar_Fin.name: Lunar Fin

Chasmlight_Fin.description:
An elegant fin taken from a defeated Xuanwen Beast's back.
The faint light it reflects contains traces of adeptal energy. In the still of the night, even the most violent beasts briefly sink into a peaceful slumber, reminiscing on times when dreams belonged not only to humans.
Chasmlight_Fin.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Lunar Fin)
- Dropped by Xuanwen Beasts
- Stardust Exchange
Chasmlight_Fin.name: Chasmlight Fin

Ruined_Hilt.description:
A stone hilt obtained from an ancient statue.
Its luster has long been lost to the depredations of seawater.
Ruined_Hilt.name: Ruined Hilt

Splintered_Hilt.description:
A stone hilt obtained from an ancient statue.
The chips and grooves speak to the brutal battles its owner once weathered.
Splintered_Hilt.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Ruined Hilt)
- Dropped by Praetorian Golem
Splintered_Hilt.name: Splintered Hilt

Still-Smoldering_Hilt.description:
A stone hilt obtained from an ancient statue.
Only the recentness of its separation from its owner may explain the as-yet unextinguished flame within.
Still-Smoldering_Hilt.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Splintered Hilt)
- Dropped by Praetorian Golem
Still-Smoldering_Hilt.name: Still-Smoldering Hilt

Axis_of_the_Secret_Source.description:
Comes from a now-defunct Secret Source Automaton.
It appears to be just a component that was used to connect two mechanisms.
Axis_of_the_Secret_Source.obtained: - Dropped by Secret Source Automaton: Hunter-Seeker
Axis_of_the_Secret_Source.name: Axis of the Secret Source

Sheath_of_the_Secret_Source.description:
Comes from a now-defunct Secret Source Automaton.
It appears to be the mechanism by which the Secret Source Automaton was powered, but its core is now empty.
Sheath_of_the_Secret_Source.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Axis of the Secret Source)
- Dropped by 40+ Secret Source Automaton: Hunter-Seeker
Sheath_of_the_Secret_Source.name: Sheath of the Secret Source

Heart_of_the_Secret_Source.description:
Comes from a now-defunct Secret Source Automaton.
It appears to be an intact core by which the Secret Source Automaton was powered, a strange device that seems to have been produced as a universal component. According to legend, the ingenious thinkers of antiquity drew upon the same wisdom used in the creation of golden patterns to design the blueprints by which these extraordinary machines functioned. Perhaps this core was one of them.
Heart_of_the_Secret_Source.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Sheath of the Secret Source)
- Dropped by 60+ Secret Source Automaton: Hunter-Seeker
Heart_of_the_Secret_Source.name: Heart of the Secret Source

Shard_of_a_Shattered_Will.description:
A fragment that houses a Wayob Manifestation.
It is a broken shard of a shattered stone idol. Its capacity for channeling the Wayob's will and power is also extremely limited.
Shard_of_a_Shattered_Will.obtained:
- Dropped by Wayob Manifestations
- Stardust Exchange
Shard_of_a_Shattered_Will.name: Shard of a Shattered Will

Locus_of_a_Clear_Will.description:
A jade idol that houses a Wayob Manifestation.
You can roughly make out the form of an idol figurine. It has a greater capacity for channeling the Wayob's will and power.
Locus_of_a_Clear_Will.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Shard of a Shattered Will)
- Dropped by 40+ Wayob Manifestations
- Stardust Exchange
Locus_of_a_Clear_Will.name: Locus of a Clear Will

Sigil_of_a_Striding_Will.description:
An obsidian talisman that houses a Wayob Manifestation.
It consists of a jade idol figurine encased in obsidian. They say that in the past, people often used such figurines to attempt to communicate directly with the Wayob of the Night Kingdom. Perhaps this also explains why the Wayob can dwell within it and manifest itself in physical form.
Sigil_of_a_Striding_Will.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Locus of a Clear Will)
- Dropped by 60+ Wayob Manifestations
Sigil_of_a_Striding_Will.name: Sigil of a Striding Will

Ignited_Stone.description:
A shard obtained from the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
Though it has been shattered to a great extent, on the inside, it still continues to burn. Perhaps this is a testament to the extraordinary vitality of phlogiston.
Ignited_Stone.name: Ignited Stone

Ignited_Seed_of_Life.description:
A condensed pile of burning matter obtained from the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
It emits a slight heat.
Attempting to stop a stone pile of this size from incessantly burning away would be a hard task indeed. It is said that this is some primordial form of life.
Ignited_Seed_of_Life.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Ignited Stone)
- Dropped by 40+ Avatars of Lava
- Stardust Exchange
Ignited_Seed_of_Life.name: Ignited Seed of Life

Ignited_Seeing_Eye.description:
A core retrieved from within the body of a defeated Avatar of Lava.
It emits a considerable heat.
It is said that once such a core has formed, left to itself, it will develop into a new Avatar of Lava. In ancient times, it was once believed that all forms of life could be traced back to conflagration, and that in the spark of burning matter lay the origins of the soul and sentient wisdom. Perhaps the very existence of Avatar of Lava would bear out such a belief - or perhaps it was the emergence of this theory itself that explains how they came to inhabit the land of Natlan...
Ignited_Seeing_Eye.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Ignited Seed of Life)
- Dropped by 60+ Avatars of Lava
Ignited_Seeing_Eye.name: Ignited Seeing Eye

Refractive_Bud.description:
A leaf bud dropped by the monster known as the Tenebrous Mimiflora after being vanquished.
It is said that when this creature emerged from the Black Tide, the first things it grew were these tender buds capable of deflecting elemental power.
Refractive_Bud.name: Refractive Bud

Bewildering_Broadleaf.description:
An arrow-shaped leaf dropped by the monster known as the Tenebrous Mimiflora after being vanquished.
After corroding the Ley Lines and extracting the memories within, the creature grows these leaves as a means of storing the information it has deciphered. There may be a close link between these intricately patterned leaves and the forms that their host can mimic.
Bewildering_Broadleaf.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Refractive Bud)
- Dropped by 40+ Tenebrous Mimesis
Bewildering_Broadleaf.name: Bewildering Broadleaf

Illusory_Leafcoil.description:
A core formed from tightly coiled leaves, the remnant of the monster known as the Tenebrous Mimiflora after being vanquished.
It may appear lifeless and dull on the surface, yet a faint, ominous power can still be sensed pulsing within.
People often wonder where the memories that such creatures drew from the earth go when they are slain. Perhaps the answer lies within this core...
Illusory_Leafcoil.obtained:
- Alchemy (3x Bewildering Broadleaf)
- Dropped by 60+ Tenebrous Mimesis
Illusory_Leafcoil.name: Illusory Leafcoil
